newsitem.title: USA: PNC to buy five Fleet offices.
newsitem.headline: PNC to buy five Fleet offices.

text.p: PNC Mortgage and Fleet Mortgage said Tuesday they signed a definitive agreement for PNC to acquire five retail mortgage origination offices from Fleet's midwestern and western regions.
Financial terms of the agreement were not disclosed. The transaction's effective date will be March 27, 1997, the companies said.
PNC will offer employment packages to about 75 Fleet loan officers in the Fleet midwestern and western regions, the companies said.
PNC will acquire Fleet Mortgage offices in Chicago, Denver, Houston, Lake Oswego, Ore., and Murray, Utah.
"This acquisition is consistent with our commitment to retail mortgage origination and with the expansion plans we announced earlier this year," said Saiyid Naqvi, chief executive of PNC Mortgage.
"We have made a strategic decision to focus our retail lending in our Northeast bank market," said Mike Torke, president of Fleet Mortgage Group.
PNC Mortgage is a unit of PNC Bank Corp, and Fleet Mortgage is a unit of Fleet Financial Group.
